content.description: Climb the green grungy face past three bolts to the shuts.
content.location: Right side of the Brutal Block. Second sport climb from the left side of this face. Route #7 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the face 8' right of Brutal Orangutan corner. Pass the first bolt and continue to the large horizontal where you can get a gear placement.  Finish by climbing the thin face above with the last bolt and to the shuts.
content.location: First sport climb right of the B.O. arete. Route #6 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start just left of the rear access point of the corridors. Climb up and lunge for the large edge below the arete. Clip the second bolt and work the face and the arete right to get the third bolt and shuts.
content.location: Right side of the Brutal Block. Righthand sport climb on this face (follows arete). Route #9 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start just right of the loose blocky rock in the corner. Climb the face past 2 bolts to the shuts.  Consensus is that this route is a 12a.
content.location: Sport line on the left end of the Brutal Block. Route #2 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the thin, pumpy face to the sidepull on the left and a long reach. Finish on slopers at the top.
content.location: Right side of the Brutal Block. 3rd climb from left (B.O. end). Route #8 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

climbs.name: The Matrix
climbs.fa: Norm and Laura Reed;  FFA, Dean Privett

content.description: Climb directly under the left side of the roof. Pull the small roof to gain access to the obvious inside corner. Finish on the corner.  Consensus is this is an 11b/c.
content.location: Center of the front of the Brutal Block. Climb follows inside corner. Route #3 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Jump start, rock stack, or climb the maple tree to reach the good edge at the lip of the cave. Climb a short 5.11+ sequence to a break, then use the arete to do a powerful static sequence or just dyno to the top...both sequences are likely around v8. Or....sit start at the back of the cave, trend slightly left, and then boulder through the head-height double digit roof problem, with a couple possible sequences, using tenuous toe hooks and finishing with a giant toss (either left or right) to the good edge at the lip. Drop off and claim the v11 tick or continue up the route and start clipping bolts. You'll definitely want a couple pads and a spot for the boulder.Initial boulder: v11?Route without initial boulder: 5.13b?Boulder into route: 5.13+All three remain projects.
content.location: Route #4 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: This climb starts on the right side of the arete and moves along a left leaning diagonal to under the roof and then straight up.  Young Adrien got the FFA on this 5.12 as he placed his first piece of gear, ever!
content.protection: Mixed.  2 bolts.  The horizontal crack takes bomber cam.

content.description: This used to be a sketchy solo to access Brutal Block.  Now a single bolt allows for safer access.
content.location: Route #1 on Brutal Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: This block hosts some of the proudest lines at The Lost Crag.  As of January 2020, route #4 which has been equipped with bolts, has still not been sent.  Some very strong climbers have yet to unlock the top crux.  Consensus is this may be a 5.13.  Routes #6-9 are mostly old school 5.10.  They have seen little traffic and could probably use some brushing.
